Level.Name: 11-12.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics”).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning [e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court Case majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses]”).

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

Level.Name: 3.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Level.Name: 3.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

Level.Name: 4.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Level.Name: 4.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

Level.Name: 4.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions].”).

Level.Name: 4.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text”).

Level.Name: 5.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Level.Name: 5.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

Level.Name: 5.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]”).

Level.Name: 5.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]”).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis reflection, and research.

Level.Name: 6.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

Level.Name: 6.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

Level.Name: 6.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics”).

Level.Name: 6.W.9b

Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate various explanations for actions or events and determine which explanation best accords with textual evidence, acknowledging where the text leaves matters uncertain.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate an author’s premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler but still accurate terms.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Follow precisely a complex multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks; analyze the specific results based on explanations in the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Synthesize information from a range of sources (e.g., texts, experiments, simulations) into a coherent understanding of a process, phenomenon, or concept, resolving conflicting information when possible.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Description: Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the relationship between a primary and secondary source on the same topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis reflection, and research.

Level.Name: 7.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the relationship between a primary and secondary source on the same topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis reflection, and research.

Level.Name: 8.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

Level.Name: 8.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 8.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new”).

Level.Name: 8.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

Level.Name: 11-12.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. D) Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary, and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 3.L.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening. A) Choose words and phrases for effect.

Level.Name: 3.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domainspecific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

Level.Name: 3.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Provide a concluding statement or section.

Level.Name: 3.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Provide a sense of closure.

Level.Name: 4.L.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening. A) Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.

Level.Name: 4.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

Level.Name: 4.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 4.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Level.Name: 5.L.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening. A) Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

Level.Name: 5.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

Level.Name: 5.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 5.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Level.Name: 6.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 6.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 6.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 7.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 7.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 7.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 8.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 8.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 8.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Apply the understanding that usage is a matter of convention, can change over time, and is sometimes contested.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Resolve issues of complex or contested usage, consulting references (e.g., Merriam-Webster’s Dictionary of English Usage, Garner’s Modern American Usage) as needed.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Observe hyphenation conventions.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Spell correctly.

Level.Name: 3.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

Level.Name: 3.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

Level.Name: 3.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Use abstract nouns (e.g., childhood).

Level.Name: 3.L.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. D) Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

Level.Name: 3.L.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. E) Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

Level.Name: 3.L.1f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. F) Ensure subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.*

Level.Name: 3.L.1g
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. G) Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

Level.Name: 3.L.1h
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. H) Use coordinating and subordinating conjunctions.

Level.Name: 3.L.1i
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. I) Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

Level.Name: 3.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Capitalize appropriate words in titles.

Level.Name: 3.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Use commas in addresses.

Level.Name: 3.L.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. C) Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

Level.Name: 3.L.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. D) Form and use possessives.

Level.Name: 3.L.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. E) Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

Level.Name: 3.L.2f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. F) Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.

Level.Name: 3.L.2g
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. G) Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

Level.Name: 4.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).

Level.Name: 4.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.

Level.Name: 4.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

Level.Name: 4.L.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. D) Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).

Level.Name: 4.L.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. E) Form and use prepositional phrases.

Level.Name: 4.L.1f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. F) Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.*

Level.Name: 4.L.1g
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. G) Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).*

Level.Name: 4.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Use correct capitalization.

Level.Name: 4.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

Level.Name: 4.L.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. C) Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

Level.Name: 4.L.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. D) Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

Level.Name: 4.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 5.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function in particular sentences.

Level.Name: 5.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

Level.Name: 5.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

Level.Name: 5.L.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. D) Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.*

Level.Name: 5.L.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. E) Use correlative conjunctions (e.g., either/or, neither/nor).

Level.Name: 5.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Use punctuation to separate items in a series.*

Level.Name: 5.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

Level.Name: 5.L.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. C) Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you, Steve?).

Level.Name: 5.L.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. D) Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

Level.Name: 5.L.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. E) Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

Level.Name: 6.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

Level.Name: 6.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Use intensive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves).

Level.Name: 6.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

Level.Name: 6.L.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. D) Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

Level.Name: 6.L.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. E) Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language.

Level.Name: 6.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

Level.Name: 6.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Spell correctly.

Level.Name: 7.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

Level.Name: 7.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

Level.Name: 7.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

Level.Name: 7.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

Level.Name: 7.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Spell correctly.

Level.Name: 8.L.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. A) Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in particular sentences.

Level.Name: 8.L.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. B) Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

Level.Name: 8.L.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. C) Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.

Level.Name: 8.L.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking. D) Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

Level.Name: 8.L.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. A) Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

Level.Name: 8.L.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. B) Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

Level.Name: 8.L.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing. C) Spell correctly.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information.

Level.Name: 3.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Level.Name: 5.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 6.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 6.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 7.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

Level.Name: 7.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 8.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Level.Name: 8.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11–12 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 11, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 11–CCR text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of the grades 11–CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 11, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 11–CCR text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of the grades 11–CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 11–12 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. A) Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. B) Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience’s knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. D) Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. A) Introduce a topic and organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. B) Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge of the topic.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. C) Use varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. D) Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; convey a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

Level.Name: 11-12.WHST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience.

Level.Name: 3.RF.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. A) Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

Level.Name: 3.RF.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. B) Decode words with common Latin suffixes.

Level.Name: 3.RF.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. C) Decode multisyllable words.

Level.Name: 3.RF.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. D) Read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

Level.Name: 3.RF.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. A) Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

Level.Name: 3.RF.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. B) Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

Level.Name: 3.RF.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. C) Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Level.Name: 3.RI.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 3.RL.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 3.W.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 4.RF.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. A) Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

Level.Name: 4.RF.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. A) Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

Level.Name: 4.RF.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. B) Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

Level.Name: 4.RF.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. C) Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Level.Name: 4.RI.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 4–5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Level.Name: 4.RL.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4–5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Level.Name: 4.W.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 5.RF.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words. A) Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

Level.Name: 5.RF.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. A) Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

Level.Name: 5.RF.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. B) Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

Level.Name: 5.RF.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension. C) Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Level.Name: 5.RI.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 4–5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 5.RL.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 4–5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 5.W.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 6–8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 6–8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. A) Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. B) Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. D) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. A) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories as appropriate to achieving purpose; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. B) Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. C) Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. E) Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.2f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes. F) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

Level.Name: 6-8.WHST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.
