Level.Name: F
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Perform arithmetic operations on polynomials.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Understand the relationship between zeros and factors of polynomials.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Use polynomial identities to solve problems.

Level.Name: XXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Rewrite rational expressions.

Level.Name: G
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Create equations that describe numbers or relationships

Level.Name: H
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Understand solving equations as a process of reasoning and explain the reasoning.

Level.Name: I
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Solve equations and inequalities in one variable.

Level.Name: J
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Represent and solve equations and inequalities graphically.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Solve systems of equations.

Level.Name: D
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Interpret the structure of expressions.

Level.Name: E
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Algebra: Write expressions in equivalent forms to solve problems.

Level.Name: A-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Know number names and the count sequence

Level.Name: B-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Count to tell the number of objects.

Level.Name: C-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Compare Numbers

Level.Name: B-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Work with radicals and integer exponents.

Level.Name: C-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.

Level.Name: C-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand the connections between proportional relationships, lines, and linear equations.

Level.Name: D-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve real-life and mathematical problems using numerical and algebraic expressions and equations.

Level.Name: D-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Analyze and solve linear equations and pairs of simultaneous linear equations.

Level.Name: E-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply and extend previous understandings of arithmetic to algebraic expressions.

Level.Name: F-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Reason about and solve one-variable equations and inequalities.

Level.Name: G-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and analyze quantitative relationships between dependent and independent variables.

Level.Name: N
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Build a function that models a relationship between two quantities.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Build new functions from existing functions.

Level.Name: K
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Understand the concept of a function and use function notation.

Level.Name: L
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Interpret functions that arise in applications in terms of the context.

Level.Name: M
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Analyze functions using different representations.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Construct and compare linear and exponential models and solve problems.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Interpret expressions for functions in terms of the situation they model.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Extend the domain of trigonometric functions using the unit circle.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Model periodic phenomena with trigonometric functions.

Level.Name: XXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Functions: Prove and apply trigonometric identities.

Level.Name: E-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Define, evaluate, and compare functions.

Level.Name: F-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use functions to model relationships between quantities.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Understand and apply theorems about circles.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Find arc lengths and areas of sectors of circles.

Level.Name: O
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Prove geometric theorems.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Experiment with transformations in the place.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Understand congruence in terms of rigid motions.

Level.Name: XXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Make geometric constructions.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Explain volume formulas and use them to solve problems.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Visualize relationships between two-dimensional and three-dimensional objects.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Translate between the geometric description and the equation for a conic section.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Use coordinates to prove simple geometric theorems algebraically.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Apply geometric concepts in modeling situations.

Level.Name: P
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Define trigonometric ratios and solve problems involving right triangles.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Understand similarity in terms of similarity transformations.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Prove theorems involving similarity.

Level.Name: XXXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometry: Apply trigonometry to general triangles.

Level.Name: E-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Draw, construct, and describe geometrical figures and describe the relationship between them.

Level.Name: F-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve real-life and mathematical problems involving angle measure, area, surface area, and volume.

Level.Name: G-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand congruence and similarity using physical models, transparencies, or geometry software.

Level.Name: H-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, surface area, and volume.

Level.Name: H-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand and apply the Pythagorean Theorem.

Level.Name: H-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Identify and describe shapes (squares, circles, triangles, rectangles, hexagons, cubes, cones, cylinders, and spheres).

Level.Name: I-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving volume of cylinders, cones, and spheres.

Level.Name: I-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Analyze, compare, create, and compose shapes.

Level.Name: J-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Reason with shapes and their attributes.

Level.Name: J-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Graph points on the coordinate plane to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

Level.Name: K-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Reason with shapes and their attributes.

Level.Name: K-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Reason with shapes and their attributes.

Level.Name: K-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Classify two-dimensional figures into categories based on their properties.

Level.Name: L-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Draw and identify lines and angles, and classify shapes by properties of their lines and angles.

Level.Name: F-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Measure and estimate lengths in standard units.

Level.Name: F-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Describe and compare measurable attributes.

Level.Name: G-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Relate addition and subtraction to length.

Level.Name: G-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve problems involving measurement and estimation of intervals of time, liquid volumes, and masses of objects.

Level.Name: G-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Convert like measurement units within a given measurement system.

Level.Name: G-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Classify objects and count the number of objects in each category.

Level.Name: H-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Measure lengths indirectly and by iterating length units.

Level.Name: H-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Work with time and money.

Level.Name: H-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and interpret data.

Level.Name: H-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and interpret data.

Level.Name: I-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Tell and write time.

Level.Name: I-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and interpret data.

Level.Name: I-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometric measurement: understand concepts of area and relate area to multiplication and to addition.

Level.Name: I-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve problems involving measurement and conversion of measurement from a larger unit to a smaller unit.

Level.Name: I-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometric measurement: understand concepts of volume and relate volume to multiplication and to addition.

Level.Name: J-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and interpret data.

Level.Name: J-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometric measurement: recognize perimeter as an attribute of plane figures and distinguish between linear and area measures.

Level.Name: J-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and interpret data.

Level.Name: K-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Geometric measurement: understand concepts of angle and measure angles.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Perform arithmetic operations with complex numbers.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Represent complex numbers and their operations on the complex plane.

Level.Name: XXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Use complex numbers in polynomial identities and equations.

Level.Name: C
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Reason quantitatively and use units to solve problems.

Level.Name: A
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Extend the properties of exponents to rational exponents.

Level.Name: B
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Use properties of rational and irrational numbers.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Represent and model with vector quantities.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Perform operations on vectors.

Level.Name: XXX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Number and Quantities: Perform operations on matrices and use matrices in applications.

Level.Name: C-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand the place value system.

Level.Name: D-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand place value.

Level.Name: D-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Generalize place value understanding for multi-digit whole numbers.

Level.Name: D-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Perform operations with multi-digit whole numbers and with decimals to hundredths.

Level.Name: E-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Extend the counting sequence.

Level.Name: E-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use place value understanding and properties of operations to add and subtract.

Level.Name: E-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use place value understanding and properties of operations to perform multi-digit arithmetic.

Level.Name: E-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use place value understanding and properties of operations to perform multi-digit arithmetic.

Level.Name: E-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Work with numbers 11-19 to gain foundations for place value.

Level.Name: F-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand place value.

Level.Name: G-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use place value understanding and properties of operations to add and subtract.

Level.Name: E-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use equivalent fractions as a strategy to add and subtract fractions.

Level.Name: F-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Develop understanding of fractions as numbers.

Level.Name: F-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Extend understanding of fractions equivalence and ordering.

Level.Name: F-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to multiply and divide fractions.

Level.Name: G-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Build fractions from unit fractions by applying and extending previous understandings of operations on whole numbers.

Level.Name: H-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand decimal notation for fractions, and compare decimal fractions.

Level.Name: A-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Know that there are numbers that are not rational, and approximate them by rational numbers.

Level.Name: B-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division to divide fractions by fractions.

Level.Name: B-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply and extend previous understandings of operations with fractions to add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers.

Level.Name: C-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Compute fluently with muti-digit numbers and find common factors and multiples.

Level.Name: D-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply and extend previous understandings of numbers to the system of rational numbers.

Level.Name: A-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction.

Level.Name: A-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and solve problems involving addition and subtraction.

Level.Name: A-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division.

Level.Name: A-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use the four operations with whole numbers to solve problems.

Level.Name: A-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Write and interpret numerical expressions.

Level.Name: B-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand and apply properties of operations and the relationship between addition and subtraction.

Level.Name: B-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Add and subtract within 20.

Level.Name: B-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand properties of multiplication and the relationship between multiplication and division.

Level.Name: B-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Get familiarity with factors and multiples.

Level.Name: B-5
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Analyze patterns and relationships.

Level.Name: C-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Add and subtract within 20.

Level.Name: C-2
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Work with equal groups of objects to gain foundations for multiplication.

Level.Name: C-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Multiply and divide within 100.

Level.Name: C-4
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Generate and analyze patterns.

Level.Name: D-1
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Work with addition and subtraction equations.

Level.Name: D-3
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Solve problems involving the four operations, and identify and explain patterns in arithmetic.

Level.Name: D-KG
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand addition as putting together and adding to, and understand subtraction as taking apart and taking from.

Level.Name: A-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Understand ration concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.

Level.Name: A-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Analyze proportional relationships and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Understand independence and conditional probability and use them to interpret data.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Use the rules of probability to compute probabilities of compound events in a uniform probability model.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Understand and evaluate random processes underlying statistical experiments.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Make inferences and justify conclusions from sample surveys, experiments, and observational studies.

Level.Name: Q
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Summarize, represent, and interpret data on a single count or measurement variable.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Summarize, represent, and interpret data on two categorical and quantitative variables.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Interpret linear models.

Level.Name: X
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Calculate expected values and use them to solve problems.

Level.Name: XX
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Statistics and Probability: Use probability to evaluate outcomes of decisions.

Level.Name: G-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use random sampling to draw inferences about a population.

Level.Name: H-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Draw informal comparative inferences about two populations

Level.Name: I-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Develop understanding of statistical variability.

Level.Name: I-7
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Investigate chance processes and develop, use, and evaluate probability models.

Level.Name: J-6
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Summarize and describe distributions.

Level.Name: J-8
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Investigate patterns of association in bivariate data.

Level.Name: A
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply mathematics to solve well-posed problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace.

Level.Name: B
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Select and use appropriate tools strategically.

Level.Name: C
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Interpret results in the context of a situation.

Level.Name: D
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Identify important quantities in a practical situation and map their relationships (e.g., using diagrams, two-way tables, graphs, flowcharts, or formulas). (DOK 1, 2, 3)

Level.Name: A
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Test propositions or conjectures with specific examples.

Level.Name: B
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Construct, autonomously, chains of reasoning that will justify or refute propositions or conjectures.

Level.Name: C
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: State logical assumptions being used.

Level.Name: D
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use the technique of breaking an argument into cases.

Level.Name: E
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Distinguish correct logic or reasoning from that which is flawed, and—if there is a flaw in the argument—explain what it is.

Level.Name: F
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Base arguments on concrete referents such as objects, drawings, diagrams, and actions.

Level.Name: G
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: At later grades, determine conditions under which an argument does and does not apply. (For example, area increases with perimeter for squares, but not for all plane figures.)

Level.Name: A
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Test propositions or conjectures with specific examples.

Level.Name: B
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Construct, autonomously, chains of reasoning that will justify or refute propositions or conjectures.

Level.Name: C
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: State logical assumptions being used.

Level.Name: D
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Use the technique of breaking an argument into cases.

Level.Name: E
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Distinguish correct logic or reasoning from that which is flawed, and—if there is a flaw in the argument—explain what it is.

Level.Name: F
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Base arguments on concrete referents such as objects, drawings, diagrams, and actions.

Level.Name: G

Level.Name: A
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Apply mathematics to solve problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace.

Level.Name: B
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Construct, autonomously, chains of reasoning to justify mathematical models used, interpretations made, and solutions proposed for a complex problem.

Level.Name: C
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: State logical assumptions being used.

Level.Name: D
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Interpret results in the context of a situation.

Level.Name: E
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Analyze the adequacy of and make improvements to an existing model or develop a mathematical model of a real phenomenon.

Level.Name: F
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Identify important quantities in a practical situation and map their relationships (e.g., using diagrams, two-way tables, graphs, flowcharts, or formulas).

Level.Name: G
Level.Subject: MATH
Level.Description: Identify, analyze and synthesize relevant external resources to pose or solve problems.

Level.Description: WORD MEANINGS: Determine intended meanings of words, including domain-specific (tier 3) words and academic (tier 2) words with multiple meanings, based on context, word relationships, word structure (e.g., common roots, affixes), or use of resources (e.g., beginning dictionary, glossary)

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: REASONING & EVIDENCE: Use supporting evidence to interpret and explain how information is presented or connected within or across texts (author’s point of view, ideas and supporting details, relationships)

Level.Subject: ELA

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: REASONING & EVALUATION: Apply reasoning and a range of textual evidence to or justify analyses of author’s presentation of information (author’s line of reasoning, point of view/purpose; relevance of evidence or elaboration to support claims; development or connections among complex concepts ideas)

Level.Description: REASONING & EVALUATION: Apply reasoning and a range of textual evidence to or justify analyses of author’s presentation of information (author’s line of reasoning, point of view/purpose; relevance of evidence or elaboration to support claims; development or connections among complex concepts ideas)

Level.Description: REASONING & EVIDENCE: Use supporting evidence to justify interpretations of information presented or how it is integrated (author’s reasoning; interactions among events, concepts, people, or development of ideas)

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: REASONING & EVALUATION: Apply reasoning and a range of textual evidence to or justify analyses of author’s presentation of information (author’s line of reasoning, point of view/purpose; relevance of evidence or elaboration to support claims; development or connections among complex concepts ideas)

Level.Description: ANALYSIS WITHIN OR ACROSS TEXTS: Analyze and compare relationships within or across texts (point of view, genre features, topic)

Level.Description: ANALYSIS WITHIN OR ACROSS TEXTS: Analyze one or more texts to determine how connections are made among topics/ information presented; or how conflicting information or presentation format reveals author interpretation of the topic

Level.Description: ANALYSIS WITHIN OR ACROSS TEXTS: Analyze texts to determine how connections are made in development of complex ideas or events; or in development of topics, themes, rhetorical features

Level.Description: COMPOSE FULL TEXTS: Write full compositions demonstrating narrative strategies (dialogue, sensory or concrete details, description), structures, and authors’ craft appropriate to purpose (detailing characters, plot, and setting)

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: COMPOSE FULL TEXTS: The CC places low instructional emphasis (20%) on narrative writing at high school. Developing full narrative compositions will not be required in the SBAC summative assessment; however the use of narrative strategies may be included as a scoring criterion when evaluating writing for other purposes in high school.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., conceive, conception, conceivable).

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, its etymology, or its standard usage.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 11-12.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11–12 texts and topics.

Level.Name: 3.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 3.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

Level.Name: 3.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

Level.Name: 3.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 3.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

Level.Name: 4.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 4.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Level.Name: 4.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 4.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

Level.Name: 4.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

Level.Name: 4.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

Level.Name: 5.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 5.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Level.Name: 5.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 5.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 5.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

Level.Name: 5.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6–8 texts and topics

Level.Name: 6.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 6.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

Level.Name: 6.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Level.Name: 6.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 6.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 6.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Level.Name: 6.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6–8 texts and topics

Level.Name: 7.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 7.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

Level.Name: 7.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Level.Name: 7.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 7.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 7.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

Level.Name: 7.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 7.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6–8 texts and topics

Level.Name: 8.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 8.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

Level.Name: 8.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Level.Name: 8.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 8.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 8.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

Level.Name: 8.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 8.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate authors’ differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors’ claims, reasoning, and evidence.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate an author’s premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly effective, analyzing how style and content contribute to the power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning (e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses).

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information.

Level.Name: 3.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

Level.Name: 3.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

Level.Name: 3.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Level.Name: 4.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

Level.Name: 4.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

Level.Name: 4.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

Level.Name: 4.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Level.Name: 5.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

Level.Name: 5.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

Level.Name: 5.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Level.Name: 7.RI.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 7.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

Level.Name: 7.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.6

Level.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Level.Name: 8.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

Level.Name: 8.RI.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze seventeenth-, eighteenth-, and nineteenth-century foundational U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (including The Declaration of Independence, the Preamble to the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and Lincoln’s Second Inaugural Address) for their themes, purposes, and rhetorical features.

Level.Name: 3.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Level.Name: 4.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

Level.Name: 4.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Level.Name: 5.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

Level.Name: 5.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Level.Name: 6.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Level.Name: 6.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Level.Name: 7.RI.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

Level.Name: 7.RI.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Level.Name: 8.RI.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, including whether the structure makes points clear, convincing, and engaging.

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, uantitatively) as well as in words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas.

Level.Name: 11-12.RST.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Level.Name: 3.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

Level.Name: 3.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

Level.Name: 4.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

Level.Name: 4.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

Level.Name: 5.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Level.Name: 6.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

Level.Name: 6.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Level.Name: 7.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

Level.Name: 7.RI.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

Level.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Level.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Level.Name: 8.RI.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Level.Name: 11-12.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Level.Name: 9-10.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Level.Name: 3.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. A) Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

Level.Name: 3.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. B) Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

Level.Name: 4.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 4.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Level.Name: 4.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 4.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

Level.Name: 4.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Level.Name: 5.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 5.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Level.Name: 5.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 5.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

Level.Name: 5.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Level.Name: 6.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

Level.Name: 6.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Level.Name: 6.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Level.Name: 7.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

Level.Name: 7.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 7.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Level.Name: 8.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Level.Name: 8.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

Level.Name: 8.RI.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.1
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole.

Level.Name: 11-12.RH.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Evaluate various explanations for actions or events and determine which explanation best accords with textual evidence, acknowledging where the text leaves matters uncertain.

Level.Description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

Level.Description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Level.Name: 4.RL.3

Level.Description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Level.Description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 3.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

Level.Name: 4.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

Level.Name: 5.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

Level.Name: 6.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Level.Name: 7.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 8.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 9.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., conceive, conception, conceivable).

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, its etymology, or its standard usage.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 11-12.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

Level.Name: 3.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 3.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

Level.Name: 3.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

Level.Name: 3.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 3.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

Level.Name: 3.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

Level.Name: 4.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 4.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Level.Name: 4.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 4.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

Level.Name: 4.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

Level.Name: 5.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 5.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Level.Name: 5.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Level.Name: 5.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 5.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

Level.Name: 6.L.4a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Name: 6.L.4b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

Level.Name: 6.L.4c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Level.Name: 6.L.4d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Level.Name: 6.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 6.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Level.Name: 6.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 6.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
