Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

Level.Name: 7.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

Level.Name: 7.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 7.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

Level.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 9.L.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Level.Name: 9.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the impact of the author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze a case in which grasping point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

Level.Name: 3.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

Level.Name: 3.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

Level.Name: 3.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

Level.Name: 4.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

Level.Name: 4.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

Level.Name: 4.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

Level.Name: 5.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

Level.Name: 5.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

Level.Name: 5.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

Level.Name: 6.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Level.Name: 6.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Level.Name: 6.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Level.Name: 7.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 7.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

Level.Name: 7.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

Level.Name: 8.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 8.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Level.Name: 8.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

Level.Name: 9.RL.2
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Level.Name: 9.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Level.Name: 9.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the impact of the author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics.

Level.Name: 3.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

Level.Name: 4.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

Level.Name: 4.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

Level.Name: 4.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

Level.Name: 5.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

Level.Name: 5.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Level.Name: 6.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Level.Name: 6.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Level.Name: 6.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Level.Name: 7.RL.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

Level.Name: 7.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

Level.Name: 8.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Level.Name: 8.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

Level.Name: 9.RL.3
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Level.Name: 9.RL.9
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning as well as its aesthetic impact.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

Level.Name: 3.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

Level.Name: 3.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

Level.Name: 4.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

Level.Name: 5.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

Level.Name: 5.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

Level.Name: 6.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

Level.Name: 6.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

Level.Name: 7.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

Level.Name: 7.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

Level.Name: 8.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

Level.Name: 8.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

Level.Name: 9.RL.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

Level.Name: 9.RL.7
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

Level.Name: 11-12.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Level.Name: 11-12.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

Level.Name: 9-10.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Level.Name: 3.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. A) Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

Level.Name: 3.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

Level.Name: 4.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

Level.Name: 4.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Level.Name: 5.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

Level.Name: 5.L.5b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Level.Name: 5.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

Level.Name: 6.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

Level.Name: 6.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Level.Name: 6.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Level.Name: 7.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

Level.Name: 7.L.5c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

Level.Name: 7.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

Level.Name: 8.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Level.Name: 8.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Level.Name: 9.L.5a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Level.Name: 9.RL.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation and its significance, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

Level.Name: 3.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Level.Name: 3.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

Level.Name: 3.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

Level.Name: 3.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Provide a sense of closure.

Level.Name: 4.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Orient the reader by establishing a situationand introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Level.Name: 4.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

Level.Name: 4.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

Level.Name: 4.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Level.Name: 4.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 5.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Level.Name: 5.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

Level.Name: 5.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

Level.Name: 5.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Level.Name: 5.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 6.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Level.Name: 6.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 6.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Level.Name: 6.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 6.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 7.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Level.Name: 7.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 7.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and lauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Level.Name: 7.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 7.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 8.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Level.Name: 8.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 8.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.

Level.Name: 8.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 8.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information.

Level.Name: 3.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Level.Name: 4.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 5.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 6.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

Level.Name: 7.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

Level.Name: 8.W.6
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

C) Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 11-12.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grades 11–12 on page 54.)

Level.Name: 11-12.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics”).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning [e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court Case majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses]”).

Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including Grade 6).

Level.Name: 6.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics”).

Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

Level.Name: 7.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Level.Name: 7.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 7.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and lauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Level.Name: 7.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 7.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 7.W.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 7.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 7 on page 52.)

Level.Name: 7.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history”).

Level.Name: 7.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims”).

Level.Name: 8.W.3a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Level.Name: 8.W.3b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Level.Name: 8.W.3c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.

Level.Name: 8.W.3d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Level.Name: 8.W.3e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

Level.Name: 8.W.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 8.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

Level.Name: 8.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new”).

Level.Name: 8.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. A) Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. B) Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge of the topic.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. C) Use appropriate and varied transitions and syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. D) Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary, and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. E) Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. F) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

Level.Name: 3.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 3.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

Level.Name: 3.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. C) Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

Level.Name: 3.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Provide a concluding statement or section.

Level.Name: 4.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 4.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

Level.Name: 4.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. C) Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

Level.Name: 4.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 4.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. E) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

Level.Name: 4.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions].”).

Level.Name: 4.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text”).

Level.Name: 5.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 5.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

Level.Name: 5.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. C) Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

Level.Name: 5.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 5.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. E) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

Level.Name: 5.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]”).

Level.Name: 5.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]”).

Level.Name: 6.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 6.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. B) Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Level.Name: 6.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. C) Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 6.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 6.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. E) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. F) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 7.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. E) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. Level.Name: 11-12.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and overreliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics”).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning [e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court Case majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses]”).

Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 6.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including Grade 6).

Level.Name: 6.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

Level.Name: 6.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not”).

Level.Name: 7.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/ effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 7.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. B) Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Level.Name: 7.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. C) Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 7.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 7.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. E) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Name: 7.W.2f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. F) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

Level.Name: 7.W.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 7.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 7 on page 52.)

Level.Name: 7.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 7.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history”).

Level.Name: 7.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. “Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims”).

Level.Name: 8.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 8.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. B) Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Level.Name: 8.W.2c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. C) Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Level.Name: 8.W.2d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. D) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Level.Name: 8.W.2e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. E) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Name: 8.W.2f
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. F) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

Level.Name: 8.W.4
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Level.Name: 8.W.5
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

Level.Name: 8.W.8
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Level.Name: 8.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new”).

Level.Name: 8.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

Level.Name: 11-12.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content. A) Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 3.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 3.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

Level.Name: 4.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 4.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

Level.Name: 5.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. A) Introduce a topic clearly, provide a general observation and focus, and group related information logically; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 5.W.2b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. B) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

Level.Name: 6.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 7.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/ effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 8.W.2a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. A) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. A) Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. B) Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience’s knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. D) Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

Level.Name: 11-12.W.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

Level.Name: 3.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons. A) Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.

Level.Name: 3.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons. B) Provide reasons that support the opinion.

Level.Name: 3.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons. C) Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

Level.Name: 3.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons. D) Provide a concluding statement or section.

Level.Name: 4.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. A) Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

Level.Name: 4.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. B) Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

Level.Name: 4.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. C) Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

Level.Name: 4.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. D) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

Level.Name: 4.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions].”).

Level.Name: 4.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text”).

Level.Name: 5.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. A) Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

Level.Name: 5.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. B) Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.

Level.Name: 5.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. C) Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

Level.Name: 5.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. D) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

Level.Name: 5.W.9a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]”).

Level.Name: 5.W.9b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]”).

Level.Name: 6.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. A) Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

Level.Name: 6.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. B) Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

Level.Name: 6.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

Level.Name: 6.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. D) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Name: 6.W.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

Level.Name: 7.W.10
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Level.Name: 7.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. A) Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

Level.Name: 7.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. B) Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

Level.Name: 7.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

Level.Name: 7.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. D) Establish and maintain a formal style.

Level.Name: 7.W.1e
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

Level.Name: 8.W.1a
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. A) Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

Level.Name: 8.W.1b
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. B) Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

Level.Name: 8.W.1c
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Level.Name: 8.W.1d
Level.Subject: ELA
Level.Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. D) Establish and maintain a formal style.
